intro: Cyrtandra lasiantha, commonly known as the Hawaiian starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and streamside areas. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough, textured surface. Cyrtandra lasiantha plays an important role in the ecological diversity of Hawaii's native flora.
